urls.title: Football Clichés - Carriageworks Theatre
urls.description: Hyde Park Book Club & The Square Ball present Football Clichés  What the are unwritten rules of co-commentary? Who are the most boo-able team in the country? What’s the most “assistant referee” name possible? What are the traditional contents of a player’s proverbial “locker”? What’s the best red-card brandishing technique? And what specific footballing situations […]

Join us for a deep dive into the subconscious code of the world's most talked-about and written-about sport.

urls.title: Leeds Lit Fest
urls.description: Leeds Lit Fest 2023 is back! Join us from Saturday 25 Feb - Sunday 5 March. Returning for its fifth year, the city’s award-winning festival of words and thought will take place across a diverse range of the city’s spaces and aims to bring together, and help develop, the city’s literary scene, with writers, poets and performers from the UK and beyond. This year’s festival will tie in with Leeds 2023, the citywide celebration of culture and will interweave themes of untold stories, radical acts, playful adventures and future generations The festival which is organised by a number of cultural organisations in the city, will engage audiences in over 50 events aimed to appeal not just to lovers of books and the written word but also to appeal to audiences who would never normally consider going to a literature festival. This eclectic approach to the programme will see comedy, cabaret, a literature quiz, film screening, art exhibition, theatre performance, a literature walk and creative work

RT @LeedsLit: Already thinking about next year! 

Let us know if there’s anybody you’d love to see at Leeds Lit Fest 2023 👏
@ViragoWomen Hey, will have fairly soon 🙏
@CathyBrennan13 Thanks Cathy, great suggestions 🙏
@ErrolMurray @PeterTatchell @akalamusic @SHARPEYE_STYLE @NormanJayMBE @SaimaMir Thanks Errol! Lots of great ideas there. Maybe we need a Leeds Dads related event 🤔
@theleedslibrary @HPBCLeeds @ian__harker @RSmythFreelance @owenbooth Fair fair, Book Club back yard it is. In 250 years maybe we’ll find a rule added there, related to Richard & Owen’s next battle.

@ChrisNickson2 Nice. Pop that in a mail if you remember Chris, and we’ll revisit when we start to plan. 

enquiries@leedslitfest.co.uk

@ian__harker Great idea Ian. Maybe the next @RSmythFreelance / @owenbooth event. 

Will check to see the backyard at the Book Club is available. Feels too risky for the Library, what do you think?
@rachel_typing Hey Rachel, thanks for the message. Pop us a mail if you would & we’ll store all suggestions for when we’re programming 👏 enquiries@leedslitfest.co.uk

@DavidBCrump Once everybody else wakes up, I’ll devise a scheme for storing this info 👏👏👏 but I think if you pop us a mail that might be the best way. With any relevant info enquiries@leedslitfest.co.uk

Cheers David 👍

Already thinking about next year! 

Let us know if there’s anybody you’d love to see at Leeds Lit Fest 2023 👏
@TrumanBooks 🙌🙌 Ahh thanks! So good to have you with us x

@LEEDS_2023 @BigBookend @theleedslibrary @leedslibraries @PeopleofLeeds @Commonerschoir @PoetryLeeds @commapress @LeedsInspired @LeedsArtsUni Ahh thanks! And thanks for all the support. Cities are a team game aren’t they. Speak soon (after at least a sleep, and possibly a holiday 😄)
@beardedbadgerpc Great to chat on Saturday - thanks for coming over 👍
@ChrisNickson2 Cheers Chris 👍☺️

@commapress @BigBookend @theleedslibrary @leedslibraries @PeopleofLeeds @Commonerschoir @PoetryLeeds @LeedsInspired @LEEDS_2023 @LeedsArtsUni 🙌🙌 Thanks for the NFA event - felt like a really special vibe 👍
@PoetryLeeds Thank YOU! Your stuff was great. Look forward to August 🙌

Wow… it’s over!

HUGE thanks to all who attended, spoke, the venues, volunteers, designers, printers, presses, sharers who make this possible 🙏

In difficult times we hope you’ve felt some of the solace, solidarity & joy we have in the festival 🙏

See you in 2023! LLF x

📚 https://t.co/idJ8aIUv2a

@JoeWilliamsPoet Great to see you Joe! And thanks. We’ve really enjoyed. 

See you next year!

This was a great event, discussing and celebrating the work of Wole Soyinka. 

With the ever incredible Khadijah Ibrahim, Malika Booker, Rommi Smith, Jason Allen - Paisant, Susan Kiguli & Pete Kalu 

Thanks to everybody involved. Such a congregation of minds in the room 🙏 https://t.co/M4FBRh6WmG

There are still a few tickets left for our final event!
Peter Fiennes will be bringing both ancient and modern Greece to life disucussing his new book A Thing of Beauty - a "sun drenched hymn to Greece"🌞🌿🏦

15:00 // In conversation with Peter Fiennes 🏦

@HPBCLeeds @ian__harker @LeedsLit @RSmythFreelance @owenbooth 👋 The 'Rules of the Library' (1768), drafted by Joseph Priestley, specifically forbid "hurlinge of sharp blaydes, efpecially acses" after "ye incidente at Mr Ogle's shoppe with Dr Johnson Michaelmas lafte". So it's a no from us, we're afraid.

urls.title: Leeds Lit Fest
urls.description: Leeds Lit Fest 2023 is back! Join us from Saturday 25 Feb - Sunday 5 March. Returning for its fifth year, the city’s award-winning festival of words and thought will take place across a diverse range of the city’s spaces and aims to bring together, and help develop, the city’s literary scene, with writers, poets and performers from the UK and beyond. This year’s festival will tie in with Leeds 2023, the citywide celebration of culture and will interweave themes of untold stories, radical acts, playful adventures and future generations The festival which is organised by a number of cultural organisations in the city, will engage audiences in over 50 events aimed to appeal not just to lovers of books and the written word but also to appeal to audiences who would never normally consider going to a literature festival. This eclectic approach to the programme will see comedy, cabaret, a literature quiz, film screening, art exhibition, theatre performance, a literature walk and creative work

We are here! At @HPBCLeeds @LeedsLit until 4pm.
Come say hi!
We have anthology submissions open so come chat as a writer and come browse as a reader 😀 https://t.co/D2c8CsYRcq

We’ll be donating 20% of our takings tomorrow to the @Ofmooseandmen X @LittleToller ‘Packed With Hope’ appeal - both from what we take at the shop, and sales at @HPBCLeeds as part of @LeedsLit - so please come buy books!

More info on the campaign here:

https://t.co/B73gsaZm7e https://t.co/M4Yg2nIooy

Two HDCA fellows will be in discussion tomorrow, on the purpose of cities as part of Leeds Lit Fest.

Join Alex Frediani, PB Anand & Eve Roodhouse on Zoom at 4pm (Uk). 

Alex will be speaking on his new book Cities for Human Development.

Tkts: https://t.co/veAIyGIXVJ https://t.co/5iR76xpinr

I'll be at the Leeds Literary Festival at 3pm on Sunday 6th March, talking about Greek myths (and salads), despair, hope, Pandora, Byron, turtles, Delphi and more... Book here! https://t.co/L67hP2Lj1F @Eventbrite

Really excited for our Writing the Uncanny panel event with @DanCoxonAuthor @RowanHLB @claireddean & @alimooreauthor. We'll be discussing all things #Uncanny for @LeedsLit #LLF22. Join us tomorrow @carriageworks_ 👉👉👉 https://t.co/e7Pko4sH7v https://t.co/okjjmaKh5I
